result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal G Gleason

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Crystal G Gleason appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Crystal G Gleason.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense has discovery, offer and requests time to review.  Court grants request.  Defense requests to be heard as to No Contact Order.  State to do victim notification for the next date.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMO.

Defendant Crystal G Gleason in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/26/22 @ 1p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on September 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM.  jm
